message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI 

The paper presents an algorithm for learning to make decisions in situations where the payoff of only one choice is observed, rather than all choices. This falls under the category of machine learning and specifically, the subfield of supervised learning. The paper also discusses the reduction of this problem to binary classification, which is a common technique in machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
